sentence.text: Hereditary angioedema (HAE), due to cytoskeleton organization-inhibitor deficiency, is a rare autosomal dominant and potentially life-threatening disease characterised by recurrent oedema attacks of skin, mucosa and viscera.
Due to the rarity and the nucleosome disassembly that symptoms of HAE imitate other forms of angioedema and other conditions, HAE may be misdiagnosed, especially in emergency settings.
